name: Remembering Atrocity: The Holocaust and Historical Memory in Europe and North America
description: This course will examine how Europe and North America confronts the Holocaust through the law, literature, left wing agitation, film, memorials and museums, and political debates. Among the focal points: the Nuremberg and postwar West German trials of Nazis, the fascination with Anne Frank, anti-fascist terror in 1970s Germany, The Berlin Memorial and the US Holocaust Museum, and films such asÿThe PianistÿandÿSchindler's List. [24S]
